fdd:FDD.titleName: Matroska File Format with MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding (Part 10) (H.264)

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Matroska File Format with MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding (Part 10) (H.264)
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Matroska file containing video essence encoded as MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding (Part 10) (H.264).
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Matroska file containing video essence encoded as MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding (Part 10) (H.264).

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Sound essences and other elements, not described at this time.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Both Mastroska and MPEG-4 are openly documented. Matroska is an open-source specification that is an offshoot of the Multimedia Container Format project. MPEG-4 is a standard developed by the ISO technical program JTC 1/SC 29 (WG11), aka the Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG). See MPEG web site.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: The Matroska specification is published online at http://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/index.html. The specification of MPEG-4, Advanced Video Coding (Part 10) is ISO/IEC 14496-10:2003. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 10: Advanced Video Coding.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: A format popular among independent and low-budget filmmakers for online dissemination of their finished works. Adoption in heritage repositories is not known to the authors of this website. Comments Welcome

fdd:citation.fdd:specReference: ISO/IEC 14496-10:2003 Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 10: Advanced Video Coding
ISO/IEC 14496-15:2004 Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 15: Advanced Video Coding (AVC) file format
